content.description: Start with a 2/3 finger pocket for the right hand and left lower on a good edge.  Gain a slopey good hold on the arete, wrap around left and finish up the slab on bubbly bulges.
content.location: Far end of corridor.  See pics.

content.description: Fun movement on megajugs! Follow the jug rail up and right. Top out just to the right of the detached piece of rock. This is a great beginner problem with a nice landing.
content.location: The Brain Bash boulder is made of one (larger) section of the boulder resting on top of another adjacent boulder. This route traces the adjacent boulder.

content.description: Traverse up the obvious seam on tasty edges. Begin on the lowest edges, use some fancy footwork and finagle the sharp crimps before the jugs. Once you get to the pair of jugs, the adjacent boulder is fair game. Before that, however, it's "off". A fall from the first couple of moves may lead to a graceful backward somersault off the mini starting boulder - not dangerous, just awkward. A bit soft for the grade.
content.location: Just to the left of Brain Bash V0.

content.description: The Brain Boulder is the closest boulder to the cliff line. It makes a beautiful corridor, so it shouldn't be hard to miss. Shaded all day long.
